last_episode_to_air.name: Barenaked Ladies
last_episode_to_air.overview: Space Ghost interviews the Barenaked Ladies.

name: Space Ghost Coast to Coast
overview: A cartoon superhero interacts with live guests via his television set in this parody talk show based on 1960s Hanna-Barbera cartoon character Space Ghost.

episodes.name: Spanish Translation
episodes.overview: After declaring his fondness for Mexican food, Space Ghost asks diet guru Susan Powter what super powers help "stop the insanity." Comedian Kevin Meaney discusses the virtues of wearing tight pants and the Bee Gees stop by for a short, bizarre visit.

episodes.name: Gilligan
episodes.overview: Space Ghost interviews the cast of Gilligan's Island and tries to find out if the show is real.

episodes.name: Elevator
episodes.overview: Self-proclaimed goddess of the galaxy Judy Tenuta and Space Ghost decide to visit the Elvis Chapel in Las Vegas. Space Ghost also talks with Dr. Timothy Leary, a man branded by Nixon as "the most dangerous man alive." Then, it's tacos for everybody, even actress Ashley Judd.

episodes.name: CHiPs
episodes.overview: As Space Ghost interviews his guests, Moltar introduces his fascination of the TV series "CHiPs" while he produces the show.

episodes.name: Bobcat
episodes.overview: Space Ghost's real identity Tad Ghostal is revealed by Zorak.

episodes.name: Banjo
episodes.overview: While Zorak is trying to use hypnotic powers on Space Ghost, the pet sea monkey Banjo is steadily growing out of control.

episodes.name: Punch
episodes.overview: Space Ghost finds himself making his interview with The Jerky Boys extremly awkward when he accidentally insults them and tries to change the subject by saying "Punch" multiple time to prove it loses all it's meaning when repeated.

episodes.name: Batmantis
episodes.overview: When Moltar is kidnapped by the mysterious Your Mother, Space Ghost reluctantly recruits the help of Zorak, who dresses up as the super "hero" Batmantis, to rescue him.

episodes.name: Self Help
episodes.overview: Dr. Joyce Brothers gives Space Ghost advice on how to improve himself...but eventually reveals that she believes Space Ghost has a split personality, Space Ghost sadly proves her right...

episodes.name: The Mask
episodes.overview: Space Ghost defends the honor of Lassie against the director of The Mask, whilst Jim Carrey refuses to give advice to the universe.

episodes.name: Gum, Disease
episodes.overview: Moltar is feeling sick, and his constant sneezing and throwing up do more damage than usual to the production of the show, Zorak wants some gum, and only Branford Marsalis can deliver it.

episodes.name: A Space Ghost Christmas
episodes.overview: Space Ghost, Zorak, Moltar, and the Council of Doom unite for the festive season with altered variations of Christmas classics

episodes.name: President's Day Nightmare
episodes.overview: The fate of one animation creator hangs in the balance as Space Ghost hosts a series of new cartoon shorts, only one of them, or the winner of a swimsuit competition, will emerge victorious

episodes.name: Story Book House
episodes.overview: Kirk the Storyteller and Carl the Cartoonist offer Space Ghost viewers, through Carl's drawings and Kirk's narration, "exciting" versions of classic Space Ghost: Coast 2 Coast adventures

episodes.name: Girlie Show
episodes.overview: As Space Ghost swoons over the thought of meeting Fran Drescher, whom he has a crush on, Zorak and Moltar plot a rebellion behind Space Ghost's back.

episodes.name: Hungry
episodes.overview: The Ghost Planet gang are hungry. They order a pizza but it gets delivered to the wrong address. Zorak's nephew Raymond is visiting the studio. Michael Stipe offers to take the guys to dinner, but Zorak eats Raymond instead.

episodes.name: Fire Drill
episodes.overview: Donny Osmond comes prepared for Space Ghost...so does a woolly Panda.

episodes.name: Le Livre D'Histoire
episodes.overview: Lokar reluctantly presents two clips from the Space Ghost archives to the audience, at the same time complaining about the show as a whole...

episodes.name: Sleeper
episodes.overview: Hulk Hogan asks Space Ghost who is the most powerful being in the Turner organization... and Slash is given a "warm reception" by the crew when they ditch him to drink coffee at the Cafeteria.

episodes.name: Jerk
episodes.overview: This episode starts with Brak yelling. There is a whole Zorak audience, and Space Ghost says, "The lone audience of The Apocalypse." Next, they take some calls on the show. Chad, Space Ghost's brother, calls. Then the IRS calls. Space Ghost yells for everyone to get out.

episodes.name: Urges
episodes.overview:
Zorak feels the urge to return to his home planet for "Mantis Mating Season", but is reluctant when he finds out he will die if he mates with a female. Michael Sweet persuades Zorak to make the attempt anyway.

Zorak later returns, having been saved by a male Mantis in drag who was part of a resistance movement against the Mantis mating ritual.

episodes.name: Explode
episodes.overview: While Space Ghost trades witty repartee (read: the usual insipid silliness) with Terry Jones, Lokar tries to lure Moltar away from the show and onto his own talk program with promises of lots of fancy fringe benefits.
Space Ghost is fed up with Moltar and Zorak, and decides to replace them with his super computer named Mo 2000.

episodes.name: Lovesick
episodes.overview: The show's energy takes a serious hit while Space Ghost deals with his emotions after being dumped.

episodes.name: Transcript
episodes.overview: Space Ghost interviews Jonathan Richman. That's it.

episodes.name: Sharrock
episodes.overview: The show takes a while to start, with the title music heavily extended, Thurston Moore joins the show as Ghost Planet comes under attack, forcing Space Ghost to bombard the audience with another extended musical number before finally revealing that the entire show was simply a dedication to the music of the late Sonny Sharrock.

episodes.name: Boo!
episodes.overview: Michael Norman isn't afraid of Space Ghost, and Bill Nye is afraid that he might never know what Space Ghost IS...

episodes.name: Freak Show
episodes.overview: Space Ghost's interview is interrupted by a pirate channel created by one of the show's more...dedicated fans (aka a geek who knows everything about the show and lives with his mother). Despite Moltar's efforts, the geek is determined to have his demands met before he will relinquish control.

episodes.name: Switcheroo
episodes.overview: While Space Ghost is called away on various pretenses, his evil twin brother Chad tries to take his place.

episodes.name: Surprise
episodes.overview: While Space Ghost is out, Zorak and Moltar recruit the Council of Doom to plan a surprise party for Space Ghost's birthday. But by the looks of it, the Council is hoping it'll be the unpleasant kind of surprise...

episodes.name: Glen Campbell
episodes.overview: Matt Groening, creator of The Simpsons, finally comes face to face with Space Ghost in a great interview as he salutes Space Ghost, asks him what he's a ghost of, and gives his opinion on Casper's resemblance to Richie Rich. Also, Moltar escapes...

episodes.name: Jacksonville
episodes.overview: Space Ghost is forced to deal with the annoying and easily frightened Tansit who has replaced Moltar as the show's director, when Space Ghost forces Tansit to reveal where Moltar is, he leaves his special guests Metallica to the mercy of Zorak.

episodes.name: Late Show
episodes.overview: Former Late Show with David Letterman writers scripted this unabashed spoof of late-night talk show convention.

episodes.name: Cookout
episodes.overview: This one starts out with arguments about Beefaroni, and Space Ghost elects the Council of Doom and Brak to judge a cooking contest. Zorak wants all of the bones for a soup, and they talk about cooking Space Ghost. One chef makes duck tacos, and another plays gymnastics with a dead chicken. Space Ghosts says it's a tie, and then blows up the Council of Doom, and finally Brak gets shot. He cries, and wants his lawyer. This is a double episode.

episodes.name: Art Show
episodes.overview: Space Ghost assembles artists for a special on the power of portraits.

episodes.name: Woody Allen's Fall Project
episodes.overview: Re-enactments of classic moments from the last few series played by real actors, a strange episode.

episodes.name: Rehearsal
episodes.overview: A behind the scenes episode.

episodes.name: Gallagher
episodes.overview: Space Ghost introduces 'Space Time Quiz Fun 9000' and his 'contestants'. What follows is a rapid-fire conversation in more ways than one, as Odenkirk's growing addiction to power-band blasts results in a steady volley from Space Ghost.

episodes.name: Edelweiss
episodes.overview: Zorak is zapped until he can apparently no longer regenerate, leaving Space Ghost without a bandleader. Moltar is instructed to fill in for his dearly departed friend by singing renditions of German folk songs, which puts Beck, the show's lone guest, to sleep.

episodes.name: Anniversary
episodes.overview: Space Ghost marks a 'special notch in the belt that is the Space Ghost saga'.

episodes.name: Zoltran
episodes.overview: Space Ghost chats with Robin Leach until his guest reveals that he is, in fact, an evil villain named Zoltran.

episodes.name: Pilot
episodes.overview: Lokar hosts a fake pilot for the show Birdman Coast to Coast.

episodes.name: Speck
episodes.overview: Moltar and mechanic-turned-musician Jack Logan share a creepy conversation about items underneath their beds. Meanwhile, an irritating speck in Space Ghost's eye stops the show cold, a final calamity on a night of amusing mishaps.

episodes.name: Zorak
episodes.overview: An episode dedicated to Zorak. Includes an edited version of the episode "Zorak" from the original Space Ghost series.

episodes.name: Switcheroo II
episodes.overview: Zorak and Moltar have a convention without inviting Space Ghost, prompting him to create Space Ghost Con '97.

episodes.name: Mayonnaise
episodes.overview: While attempting to introduce Jon Stewart to the wonders of aroma therapy, Moltar accidentally cuts off his oxygen.

episodes.name: Brilliant Number One
episodes.overview: Space Ghost pays homage to his real boss by continually referring to Peter Fonda as 'Ted Turner's brother-in-law.'

episodes.name: BooBooKitty
episodes.overview: During Space Ghost's interview with McKean & Lander (or lack thereof), a menacing 'kitty' blimp hovers around Ghost Planet.

episodes.name: Needledrop
episodes.overview: Space Ghost decides to do the 'hip shake' throughout the show. Meanwhile, Zorak attempts to hypnotize all the guests.

episodes.name: Sphinx
episodes.overview: Mike Judge kindly asks Space Ghost to 'whack the Rugrats.' Space Ghost agrees to the job, as long as he can get onto one of Judge's shows.

episodes.name: Pavement
episodes.overview: Space Ghost repeatedly confuses Pavement with The Beatles and saves Jupiter from Fidor. The Great Gazoo has a cameo.

episodes.name: Untitled
episodes.overview: Space Ghost, an unofficial member of the P-Funk Mob, sets the groove in motion with George Clinton, but Moltar attempts to wrest the show from Space Ghost's control so he can interview his hero and the star of TV's 'CHiPs,' Erik Estrada.

episodes.name: Hipster
episodes.overview: Space Ghost's hip brother Chad takes over the show and makes fun of how Space Ghost is a square. Zorak and Moltar keep asking what happened to Space Ghost but Chad won't tell.

episodes.name: Piledriver
episodes.overview: Grandpa Space Ghost (voiced by Randy "Macho Man" Savage, RIP) stops by the show to visit his nephew, Tad Ghostal.

episodes.name: Suckup
episodes.overview: Desperate for a new gig, Space Ghost kisses up to Talk Soup host John Henson and Entertainment Tonight host Bob Goen by telling each that they are 'pretty men.'

episodes.name: Dam
episodes.overview: Space Ghost welcomes its first-ever Academy Award–winner, Charlton Heston, who after much prodding, offers his trophy to Space Ghost.

episodes.name: Boatshow
episodes.overview: Steve Allen and Andy Dick guest-star in this musical extravaganza! Brak is on the street. Space Ghost sings. Zorak sings. Andy has to dance.

episodes.name: Brilliant Number Two
episodes.overview: Space Ghost, once again, interviews Peter Fonda and the 'moonwalking' Buzz Aldrin. This is a sequel to "Brilliant Number One".

episodes.name: Telethon
episodes.overview: Space Ghost holds a telethon with the Council of Doom because he's out of money, but ends up losing even more money.

episodes.name: Dimethylpyrimidinol Bisulfite
episodes.overview: Space Ghost and Zorak try to endorse ointment and potted meat to the home viewing audience.

episodes.name: Joshua
episodes.overview: A parody of corporate videos with a brief appearance at the end of two winners of a haiku contest.

episodes.name: Terminal
episodes.overview: Space Ghost is terminally ill and will die when the show ends, but no-one seems to care. Perhaps they see through Space Ghost's 'illness'.

episodes.name: Toast
episodes.overview: Space Ghost wants to impress the love of his life (Merrill Markoe) but doesn't know how to act around 'women of the opposite sex.

episodes.name: Lawsuit
episodes.overview: Jace, Jan, and Blip from the original Space Ghost try to sue Space Ghost. Space Ghost gets out of it, and he blasts Blip. He also claims he destroyed Paris.

episodes.name: Cahill
episodes.overview: A vicious storm on Ghost Planet has Space Ghost scared silly.  (Note: The episode's name comes from the show's editor, Michael Cahill)

episodes.name: Warren
episodes.overview: Space Ghost grows angry upon learning that he has been 'imposternated' on Warren's television program, so he goes with Moltar and Zorak to confront him. Warren is actually a very bitter bush.  We then meet an evil replica of Space Ghost, or is it Gary Owens...

episodes.name: Warren (short version)
episodes.overview: Space Ghost grows angry upon learning that he has been 'imposternated' on Warren's television program, so he goes with Moltar and Zorak to confront him. Warren is actually a very bitter bush.  We then meet an evil replica of Space Ghost, or is it Gary Owens...(this is the short version, which does not loop 3 times)

episodes.name: Chinatown
episodes.overview: Space Ghost trades Moltar to a Japanese baseball team and makes a dog the new director.

episodes.name: Rio Ghosto
episodes.overview: Space Ghost pursues a movie career.

episodes.name: Pal Joey
episodes.overview: Annoying intern Joey wreaks havoc on the set while trying to get a job. Meanwhile, Space Ghost reveals to Michael Moore that he doesn't pay his employees.

episodes.name: Curses
episodes.overview: There is a showing of part of an old Space Ghost show. Space Ghost eats a bald guest. Emo is crazy, and Space Ghost eats him. There is a pretty woman, and Space Ghost demands more guests. Space Ghost says, "I'm never eating here again." He then eats Zorak and attacks Moltar.

episodes.name: Intense Patriotism
episodes.overview: Space Ghost, Zorak, and Moltar are moving to America. Space Ghost invites Jeff Foxworthy on the show and asks him about rednecks. Jeff obviously doesn't enjoy himself. Space Ghost hopes to become America Ghost as they find a place to land, in America.

episodes.name: Waiting for Edward
episodes.overview: Moltar beats the crap out of Space Ghost in a fist fight, and then jumps up and down on his back. Later, Zorak sits on Space Ghost's lap and demands $10 for "special services".

episodes.name: Dinner with Steven
episodes.overview: Unfinished bonus value episode.

episodes.name: Chambraigne
episodes.overview: Space Ghost angers the creators of an intelligence enhancement drug when he begins to endorse it on his show.

episodes.name: Snatch
episodes.overview: Replicating Pods invade the Ghost Planet as The Blob blocks off all outside access.  Space Ghost, Zorak, and Moltar come up with many unsuccessful plans and resort to drinking lots of coffee.

episodes.name: Girl Hair
episodes.overview: Members of Hanson have long hair and Space Ghost is obsessed with combing it. Special appearances by the Tooth Fairy and Santa.

episodes.name: Sequel
episodes.overview: After Space Ghost has been sent to the slammer for years of mistreating Jan and Jace, Birdman is called upon to guest host the show, but spends most of his time lamenting an impending divorce from his wife Galaxy Girl, a.k.a. Sylvia. This is a sequel to "Lawsuit".

episodes.name: Curling Flower Space
episodes.overview: Jerry Springer and Sarah Jessica Parker nearly get trampled in this bizarre romp through the minds of Space Ghost, Moltar and Zorak.

episodes.name: Table Read
episodes.overview: The show's voice actors and writers rehearse (in live-action) the episode Fire Ant.

episodes.name: Fire Ant
episodes.overview: Space Ghost and talk show host Conan O'Brien are engaged in riveting and witty repartee when a fire ant bites Space Ghost and everything goes Dada. When first aired, the episode featured a 10-minute sequence in which Space Ghost crawls after an ant over various backgrounds.

episodes.name: King Dead
episodes.overview: Zorak and Moltar leave Ghost Planet and break into Space Ghost's apartment. Brak and Tansut replace them on the show.

episodes.name: Fire Ant (short version)
episodes.overview: A much shorter version of Space Ghost's "interview" with Conan O'Brian and his encounter with the small Fire Ant.

episodes.name: Snatch (alternate ending)
episodes.overview: Ghost Planet Industries is attacked by replicating pods. The kind that copy your DNA, kill you off, and take over while you sleep.

episodes.name: Kentucky Nightmare
episodes.overview: Space Ghost is now promoting a liquor company. With the company mascot, everything is going crazy. Windows cracked, bears attacking, and killer bees.

episodes.name: The Justice Hole
episodes.overview: An agitated Space Ghost leaves his own show, but can't find anything to do.

episodes.name: Knifin' Around
episodes.overview: Space Ghost wants to burn 100 Radiohead cd's with some kind of laser cannon, right in front of Radiohead! Moltar sings, we meet Space Ghost's wife Bjork, and Zorak talks like a hillbilly.

episodes.name: Flipmode
episodes.overview: Space Ghost is hosting a "mystery dinner theater" and in the midst, he beats Zorak senseless a number of times and causes a massive gas leak, which causes everyone to start tripping, including guest Busta Rhymes.

episodes.name: Sweet For Brak
episodes.overview: Space Ghost becomes jealous when Brak's spin off, The Brak Show becomes a hit. Meanwhile, Zorak teaches the band Tenacious D how to perform.

episodes.name: Mommentary
episodes.overview: The writers of Space Ghost: Coast 2 Coast assemble their mothers together to commentate on "Kentucky Nightmare"

episodes.name: Mommentary: Creator's Commentary
episodes.overview: The S.G writers commentate on their mothers' commentary

episodes.name: Mommentary: Jellybean
episodes.overview: Special edition of "Mommentary" with new commentary from the shows producers.

episodes.name: Baffler Meal
episodes.overview: Space Ghost's talk show is invaded by three life-sized fast food items from a place called Burger Trench. They are known as the Aqua Teen Hunger Force. They soon proceed to throw the show into total chaos.

episodes.name: Whipping Post
episodes.overview: Space Ghost is angry about a variety of topics, and rants mightily to his guest, comedian Dennis Miller

episodes.name: Eat a Peach
episodes.overview: Space Ghost Explains The Birds And Bees To Zorak And Moltar.  As in Bees can't drive and crows can shoot lasers out of they're eyes.  Also, Moltar feels bad that Space Ghost seems to give Zorak more attention, as does Todd Barry when the crew decides not to share any crow with him.

episodes.name: In Memory of Elizabeth Reed
episodes.overview: In one of the most random episodes ever, Space Ghost's interview with William Shatner is cut short when he is called into action to take part in an epic space battle.

episodes.name: Idlewild South
episodes.overview: Zorak and Moltar are doing drugs and drinking booze when the show starts. Space Ghost wonders what they're doing, and Moltar encourages Space Ghost to drink some because it will "Make you feel like a Cowboy". After 1 sip he starts riding his TV, doing the Robot, and other crazy stuff, that eventually results in a series space ship related accident.

episodes.name: Dreams
episodes.overview: Space Ghost hosts a telethon to raise money for "Retardos" and enlists Triumph's help.

episodes.name: Live at the Fillmore
episodes.overview: Television series finale. When Space Ghost spends the show budget to get himself out of jail, they have to find ways to run the show without money. They try doing a "remote without cameras" interviewing the old Susan Powter interview, interviewing a show, and punching Space Ghost in the crotch. Space Ghost then does his one man show "Racism is Bad" followed by more crotch punching and omelets.

episodes.name: Space Ghost in Perfect Hair Forever
episodes.overview: In this episode, which is almost a stand alone show as Space Ghost appears for about a minute in which he is mauled by a bear, the main character Gerald is balding. He goes to his bald "Uncle Grandfather" for advice on how to stop the balding. After sort of learning what he must do he goes on a journey that completely rips on anime in a good way.

episodes.name: Billy Mitchell
episodes.overview: Space Ghost interviews Billy Mitchell, the first person to reach a perfect score in Pac-Man and Donkey Kong score record holder.

episodes.name: Rand Miller
episodes.overview: Space Ghost interviews Rand Miller, creator of Myst.

episodes.name: Kenny Wayne Shepherd
episodes.overview: Blues musician Kenny Wayne Shepherd is interviewed.

episodes.name: Allan Alcorn
episodes.overview: "Mr. pong", Allan Alcorn, is interviewed.

episodes.name: Steve Wozniak
episodes.overview: Space Ghost interviews Steve Wozniak, co-founder of Apple.

episodes.name: Rob Fulop
episodes.overview: Space Ghost interviews Rob Fulop, creator of several hit Atari 2600 titles such as Demon Attack.

episodes.name: Howard Warshaw
episodes.overview: Space Ghost interviews Howard Warshaw, designer of E.T on the Atari 2600, often called "the worst game ever made".

episodes.name: Wayne Coyne
episodes.overview: Wayne Coyne, lead singer of the Flaming Lips, is interviewed.

episodes.name: Richard Garriott
episodes.overview: Space Ghost interviews "Lord British", other wise known as Richard Garriott, best known for creating Ultima.

episodes.name: Stephen Bristow
episodes.overview: Space Ghost interviews Stephen Bristow, an early employee of Atari who conceptualized games like Breakout.

episodes.name: David Crane
episodes.overview: Space Ghost interviews David Crane, a prolific game programmer who started work on the Atari 2600 and continued all the way up to the controversial Night Trap.

episodes.name: Chantal Claret
episodes.overview: Lead singer of the band Morningwood, Chantal Claret, is interviewed.

episodes.name: Dee Snider
episodes.overview: Space Ghost interviews the lead singer of twisted Sister, Dee Snider.

episodes.name: Barenaked Ladies
episodes.overview: Space Ghost interviews the Barenaked Ladies.
